Hi Stefano,

Unfortunately I believe that the ES-HyperNEAT implementation i=
n MultiNEAT
is not validated and might not work perfectly. You can find a v=
alidated C#
implementation here: http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/software/ES-HyperN=
EAT.zip

We are also working on a python version but this will still take a=
 little
time. If I get the time I will also take a look at MultiNEAT and se=
e what I
can do.

Best,
Sebastian

On Sat, Oct 29, 2016 at 7:34 PM, stefano=
.r.palmieri@... [neat] <
neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> I've bee=
n trying to use the ES-HyperNEAT implementation in MultiNEAT but
> have not=
 been having good performance with it.
>
>
> Here are two OpenAI Gym pole-b=
alancing examples where I've tried running
> NEAT and then ES-HyperNEAT:
>
=
>
> NEAT: https://gym.openai.com/evaluations/eval_MbHV6JqSRG6mUaL1Jezgw
>
>=

> MultiNEAT: https://gym.openai.com/evaluations/eval_0Tla6UkQGKTTCDOUi6EQ
=
>
>
> Hyperparameters are kept the same for both experiments.
>
>
> The gis=
ts with the code for the experiments can be seen on the openAI gym
> pages.=

>
>
> Am I missing something? I have tried other environments but the resu=
lts
> are always similar.
>
>
>
> 
>



--
